title: [Large-Scale] Building Personal Learning Environments and Networks (PLE&N) for Advanced Mathematics Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Undergraduate-level foundational mathematics knowledge (calculus, linear algebra, etc.)
context.additional_context: For math majors and related professionals, implementing collaborative learning via PLE&N and lifelong learning models linked to external institutions.

learning_goals: Learners can design and implement personalized mathematics learning pathways using the PLE&N platform.

Learners can use online collaborative tools such as Padlet and Google Jamboard to engage in weekly knowledge-sharing and feedback exchanges with peers and external experts on mathematical problem-solving processes at least twice a week, and submit an improved report by the end of the course that reflects at least 80% of the feedback received.
Learners enhance self-directed problem-solving skills using digital resources from a lifelong learning perspective.

resources: LMS System (Video Conferencing, Forum, Document Sharing Features)
Partnership Programs with External Institutions (Libraries, Research Centers)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
